questions.question_text: Within the asset audit form, where would you find the list of all assets that were found at the stockroom or warehouse that is being audited?

discussion.content: I would go for C, this could means All assets initially found in the stockroom, not the one that being scanned

Selected Answer: C
This is a round-about way of asking for the list of assets that are expected in a stockroom for an audit - based on the future tense of it 'being audited'.

The 'were found' could mean a past tense of the audit, in which case B would be correct, or 'were found' in the list of assets to be added to the 'Expected Assets' - so still C.

This is difficult because of the past tense (i.e. were found) in the question - perhaps the sentence is incorrectly worded

I am going with B due to the past tense

The following related lists show asset information:
Expected Assets: Shows all assets that are assigned to the stockroom or location that is being audited. The list isn’t populated until scanning begins.

Scanned Assets: Shows all assets that are scanned during the audit. The list is updated each time scans are submitted from the mobile app.

Excluded Assets: Shows all the excluded hardware assets and Enterprise Asset Management assets. The list isn't populated until scanning begin

Selected Answer: B
B, Scanned assets

Selected Answer: B
I'll go for B as the question is about Asset "Found" and not "Assigned" or expected

Expected Assets – shows all assets that are assigned to the
stockroom or location that is being audited. (Again, the list is
not populated until scanning begins.)
o Scanned Assets – shows all assets that are scanned during
the audit. The list is updated each time scans are submitted
from the mobile app.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of stock rules? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Answer:
 A. To automatically transfer assets when a low quantity threshold is detected in a stockroom
 C. To send notifications when a low quantity threshold is detected in a stockroom

Explanation: There are two restocking options
 - An email can be sent to the stockroom manager (user identified in the Manager field on the stockroom record) to place a vendor order. A task is automatically created for the stockroom manager or, if Procurement is active, purchase order and a purchase order line item are created. (c.)
 - A transfer order can be generated automatically to restock the item from another stockroom. (d.)

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/asset-management/concept/c_StockRules.html

Selected Answer: AC
AC
Stock rules send notifications or automatically transfer assets when a low-quantity threshold in a stockroom is detected.

Selected Answer: AC
The purpose of stock rules in ServiceNow includes the following two functions:

A. To automatically transfer assets when a low quantity threshold is detected in a stockroom: Stock rules can be configured to monitor the quantity of assets in a stockroom. When the quantity falls below a specified threshold, the stock rule triggers an automatic transfer of assets from another stockroom to ensure an adequate supply.

C. To send notifications when a low quantity threshold is detected in a stockroom: Stock rules can also be used to send notifications or alerts when the quantity of assets in a stockroom reaches a predefined low threshold. This notification helps to proactively manage inventory levels and avoid stockouts or delays in service.

Therefore, the correct options are:

A. To automatically transfer assets when a low quantity threshold is detected in a stockroom
C. To send notifications when a low quantity threshold is detected in a stockroom

Selected Answer: AC
Stock rules identify an action that should occur based on a threshold within a stockroom.
 Create a task assigned to the stockroom manager to create a purchase order; an
email is sent to the stockroom manager notifying them of the task
 Create a transfer order to restock from another stockroom

choices.E: To send notifications when a stock shipment arrives at a stockroom
choices.C: To send notifications when a low quantity threshold is detected in a stockroom
choices.B: To track stock orders from a vendor
choices.D: To track stock movement between stockrooms
choices.A: To automatically transfer assets when a low quantity threshold is detected in a stockroom

questions.question_text: Which of an organization’s assets are managed using stockrooms?

choices.A: All available stock, consumable or not

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
All stock - not just specific types.

Selected Answer: A
All available stock, consumable or not, is managed in stockrooms in an organization and can be moved around from stockroom to stockroom as needed.

Selected Answer: A
ALL available stock, consumable or not, is managed in stockrooms in an organization and can be moved around from stockroom to stockroom as needed

Selected Answer: A
Answer: A. Coalesce

Explanation: "The coalesce option allows you to update existing target table records when transforming import data.", note, not specific to asset import...

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-integrate-applications/page/administer/import-sets/concept/c_ImportSetCoalesce.html

questions.question_text: When using transform maps to transform imported hardware model data to your desired asset tables, what option do you set to uniquely identify the same asset in order to merge/update records?

An event runs each night to send reminders to contract administrators about contract expiration dates (e.g., so they can renew or renegotiate the contract). By default, when does the contract administrator receive these notifications? (Choose four.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDEF
C, D, E, F is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: CDEF
Page 433 of HAMF Vancouver text

Selected Answer: CDEF
CDEF
One of the most important aspects of contract management is to know when the contracts are due to expire so you can determine whether to renew, adjust (e.g., extend), or let the contract expire: 90, 60, 30 and Contract expiration day.
The above defined in the NowLearning materials

Selected Answer: CDEF
The contract administrator receives notifications related to the contract expiration
date 90, 60, and 30 days before the contract expires, and on the expiration date.
